what: SPS: Site Selection for External Validity
title: Get Started

previous_headings: SPS: Site Selection for External Validity
title: Get Started
code: covariates_use <- c("Edu", "Age", "Gen", "Eth", "GDP", "Polity", "Pop") X_use <- X_example[X_example[,"reg_Eu"] == 0, covariates_use] for(i in 1:7){     X_use[,i] <- scale(X_use[,i]) }

previous_headings: SPS: Site Selection for External Validity
title: Get Started
code: C_1  <- stratify(X_use, type = "geq", value = 0.5, columns = covariates_use) C_2 <- stratify(X_use, type = "leq", value = -0.5, columns = covariates_use) C_use <- rbind(C_1, C_2) c0_use <- rep(1, nrow(C_use))

previous_headings: SPS: Site Selection for External Validity
title: Get Started
code: out <- sps(X = X_use, N_s = 5, C = C_use, c0 = c0_use)

previous_headings: SPS: Site Selection for External Validity
title: Get Started
code: # selected countries rownames(X_use)[out$ss == 1] ## [1] "Bolivia"       "Colombia"      "Peru"          "El Salvador"   ## [5] "United States" sps_plot(out)

title: Prepare Site-Level Variables
text: Diana, please add instruction creating data . page focuses creating original data. don’t need talk specify target population sites.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Egami N, Da Lee D (2023). spsR: Synthetic Purposive Sampling. R package version 0.1.0, http://naokiegami.com/spsR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {spsR: Synthetic Purposive Sampling},   author = {Naoki Egami and Diana {Da In Lee}},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {http://naokiegami.com/spsR/}, }

title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling
text: Description: R package sps implements SPS algorithm site selection SPS estimator. Authors: Naoki Egami (Maintainer) Diana Da Lee Reference: Egami Lee. (2023+). Designing Multi-Context Studies External Validity: Site Selection via Synthetic Purposive Sampling.

title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling
text: can install recent development version using devtools package. First install devtools using following code. Note : , load devtools use function install_github() install spsR:
code: if(!require(devtools)) install.packages("spsR") library(devtools) install_github("naoki-egami/spsR", dependencies = TRUE)

what: Synthetic Purposive Sampling: Site Selection for External Validity — sps
title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling: Site Selection for External Validity — sps
text: Synthetic Purposive Sampling: Site Selection External Validity

title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling: Site Selection for External Validity — sps
code: sps(   X,   N_s,   C = NULL,   c0 = NULL,   site_selected = NULL,   site_unavailable = NULL,   lambda = c(1, 1, 0.1),   seed = 1234 )

title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling: Site Selection for External Validity — sps
text: X Site-level covariates target population sites N_s Number study sites selected C Linear constraints (left-hand side) c0 Linear constraints (right-hand side) site_selected site_unavailable lambda seed Numeric. `seed` used internally. Default = 1234.

title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling: Site Selection for External Validity — sps
text: sps returns object sps class.  ss: Estimated external robustness. W: Estimates pAMCE factors bootstrap sample. obj: Estimated values objective function X: X Q: Q N: N N_s: N_s ...: Values internal use.

title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling: Site Selection for External Validity — sps
text: Egami Lee. (2023+). Designing Multi-Context Studies External Validity: Site Selection via Synthetic Purposive Sampling. Available https://naokiegami.com/paper/sps.pdf.
